doc.after: The official service pistol for the British military during the Second World War was the Enfield No. 2 Mk I .38/200 calibre revolver,[13] but owing to a critical shortage of handguns, a number of other weapons were also adopted (first practically, then officially) to alleviate the shortage. As a result, both the Webley Mk IV in .38/200 and Webley Mk VI in .455 calibre were issued to personnel during the war.[14]
